title: AP Items Request for Balance Thoughts
body:
Hi all, 

We are really strapped for Playtesting resources at the moment. 

I'm looking for feedback (clips especially) for the following things (if people playing on PBE could grab them): 

* Liandry's Balance. 
* First item balance. 
* People who can waveclear with items where they couldn't before (especially Ludens), eg. Lux 
* General Mages vs Anybody balance. 
* Individual item balance (our thoughts are: Rylai/Liandrys > GLP > Ludens atm)
* Ryze/Cassio/Anivia/other mana stacker balance. 
* First mini mana item balance in mid lane (Lost Chapter vs Dirk vs Revolver vs Catalyst) eg. Zed/Talon/Kat/Jayce/Yasuo, etc.

General

* Please accompany clips/screenshots with the scoreboard if possible. 
* Mathematic analysis is also appreciated. (eg. Spreadsheets of damage vs targets).

replies.body: Hey all, please keep all feedback related to the topics listed in the original post. Comments that seek to derail the conversation or are otherwise off-topic may be removed. Thanks, loves!

I have an issue with the GW on Morello's costing 3000g O_o;;; at least before I paid for Mana/CD...but ADCs pay 800g to get {{item:3123}} , so now if I have to deal w/ Healing/Self-Healing I need to deviate from my build path to drop 3k on an item that has sub-par stats aside from a buffed GW effect, if that's the case I'd rather get the old GW effect to have cheaper access to it or just put the GW on something like {{item:3135}}  which actually makes sense since you know ADCs have this {{item:3033}} 

And no {{summoner:14}} is not a solution >_>;;;

It could be they want to prevent solo laners from countering sustain champs early on in the game. Raka is the only bot champ who is hard countered by GW but she does have another ally (the adc) to even an early GW counter in addition to the fact that adc's need items more than any other class so an early {{item:3123}} will put them behind more than it would a mage. To would suck to lose every trade as vlad bc the enemy bought GW at 5 min.

Not saying Riot has the right solution (not saying they don't either) but I'm guessing that is what they were thinking.

I still think there is no AP itemization for assassins, magic pen is just throwed in 1 item that gives health and ap, but they don't have a reliable access of mana and cdr like mages. Protobelt is just good with Ekko, and going lich bane first is not really that good since you need more ap to make real use of the passive, tho I think this item having more mana will allow champs like Fizz and Ekko to function better and not running oom as easily once its completed.

Cool additions will be : 

An item the likes of AP + Magic Pen + CDR + Mana/Burst active option

Giving Lich bane 500/400 mana instead of 250 and probably 20% cdr instead of 10 with the haste passive

Basically, make so AP assassins have options just as mages have, because their build paths are terrible

Most assassins can use the health anyway, they're usually in more of a position to take damage than mages. In addition to that, AD assassins also don't tend to have many options for mana because they don't typically burn through as much as mages what with low mana costs and a less spammy playstyle.

>Giving Lich bane 500/400 mana instead of 250

This is a {{champion:81}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:115}} {{champion:142}} buff more than it is an AP assassin buff.

My problem was that twin shadows was too overtuned, and liandry but you fixed that yesterday

if i had one more request it would be to look over spellbound orb 
through my experience it was possible to gather 50/60 stacks at best in my PBE games, you reduced it to 100 stacks from 200 stacks but i still think it's impossible to get the maximum power from this item

you would need to do sheningans with your team mates and tell them to pick champions like {{champion:157}}  and spam Q every single second near you but that's so awkard

**personal opinion**: reduce the maximum number of stack while reducing a bit the AP/movement speed you get
Can you give more context on why you think Twin shadows was too overtuned? It has (as of now) the same AP ratios that it had before it was removed and wasn't build that often back then.

You should not compare things to before, if the game changes the rules change, the power you had before is not the same than now if the environment changes

Twin Shadow was (i made the math) nearly 100% gold efficient when it had 80 ap

they reduced it to 60 ap, it is now nearly 89% gold efficient
reminder: 1 ap= 21.75 gold, 1% cdr=40 gold, and 7% movement is nearly 400 gold worth

so you would build a 2400 gold item that gives you 2400 gold worth of stats that are 80 ap 10% cdr 
but also 7% movement speed helping you to rotate faster and fight better
BUT also the active giving you 5 sec slow on enemies
_**compared to every single ap item in the game it would have been the STRONGEST ITEM BY FAR**_ because no ap items would do this

I knew it was going to be broken the second i saw it, but Rioters were careful and fixed it without me having to say anything

Currently Mages face some pretty annoying issues that - sadly - can't be fixed by some Item changes.

The main problem is their role:

What are they supposed to do? (Besides preventing the opponent from Armorstacking)
Historicly Mages were Midgame Carrys opposed to the Lategamecarry ADCs.

This is no longer the case. ADCs spike in Mid now - harder than most mages. And mages no longer spike at all.
(maybe once with Haunting/Sorcs)

Right now a Mage is a roaming Support for the ADC.
You AFK waveclear Mid - roam bot - get a lead onto your carry.
Once Teamfights start you peel for your carry just like any other Support.
Most of the changes are fine, however I'm surprised you guys haven't touched {{item:3027}} .
What's wrong with RoA?

My problem personally is that you don't choose to buy it because it's a late game item that sacrifices early game -

You only buy it if you have no efficient rush *at all* and are late game by default / don't need AP for early game. It's almost never a good idea to sacrifice an efficient rush or your early game AP, those have to be a non-factor for RoA to even be considered.

So really it's just a 'only taking it cus nothing is better' item, not an item you consciously choose to take.
RoA doesn't have to be core or rushed or have an immediate impact. Some items are just there to stabilize you.

None of those were related to the point I was trying to make.

The item sucks unless you have to take it. Then it's okay.
Can I ask if releasing more high AP items is out of the question and if that's the case why?

> edit:who downvoted me must be a bot spamming downvoted for everyone who ask nerfs rightfully about the support and adc class

Ofc, because anyone that dissagrees with your opinion must a bot. /s

You are getting downvoted because you are throwing a entitled hissy fit on a thread that has jack squat to do ADC's or supports. So either be constructive or shut it and grow up.
Hello there, everything this topic isn’t supposed to be about.

Hi, I was hoping for an AP QSS, Zhonyas changes to make it less punishing to get against a Zed (while he doesnt get punished for Hexdrinker), and a better build path for Rabbadons. Two NLR still isnt good. I doubt this is going to get seen but another thing I want changed is changes to Sorc boots so mages can actually get other types of boots.
Do you feel like Seekers isn't sufficient? Zed pays alternate costs,e g. he doesn't have that much AOE damage and scales pretty poorly.

Actually Seekers isn't really sufficient during the entire course of the game - ADs can hit up to 54 lethality (full assassin build) and even non-assassin champions sometimes build lethality items, and they get rewarded against mages since they can build Malmortius and QSS (meanwhile for mages, it's a waste of Gold) - Plus, mages only manage to hit 33 magic pen (not to mention malmortius surpasses the amount of max magic pen) and we even have to face a magic damage shield (which also gets affected by magic resist). Just so you see: We only have ONE armor item, why do ADs have like ... 4 magic resist ones? Maw of Malmortius, Mercurial Scimitar, can build Mercury's Treads without losing anything, Wit's End ...

Sure, seekers is great in early game, but as soon as a zed gets his duskblade the 45 armor are not going to help against its passive and his entire combo - The stasis effect isn't going to save you either, considering you either get the duskblade passive, or you get the mark (you can't save yourself from both) - The duskblade AA is instantaneous you don't have time to stasis that and the 45 armor (sorry 31.8 armor, considering the armor pen at level 6) are not helping. In mid-late game, the armor is almost irrelevant - Not to mention the sooner I stasis to dodge his duskblade AA the more time he has for the entire combo as soon as I show up. I mean, it's not just zed it's every AD - Even Kog with Wit's End gets (max) 65 magic resist ... why?

I avoided bringing the percentage armor pen / magic pen - Considering even in that domain, ADs surpass APs.

I just get frustrated that it gets hard to kill a Zed with hexdrinker first item and he retains a ton of all in damage, while I struggle hard with mana issues and a Seekers doesn't provide enough protection if i get it first. Plus the fact that you need to farm to get some bonus armor from it. Like if he doesn't go hexdrinker but I have to go seekers, he'll still get a duskblade before I complete anything and burst hard, but it doesn't feel the same other way around. Additionally he is able to go merc treads but mages rely on magic pen for their damages...

I hope this makes sense, and thank you for listening to me! It means a lot to me.
The actual problem is Hexdrinker.
What if seekers build into a new armor/AP item that didn't have an hourglass effect.  Maybe something like "gain a physical damage shield equal to 10% of Magic damage dealt " or something like that

The problem is that you just can't really outplay hexdrinker it's a pure statcheck item. If the enemy buys it he can completely negate all kill pressure you had except for like 2-3 mages that can play around it. If Zed with hexdrinker for example doesn't run into every skillshot you throw you need to invest your ultimate most of the time to pop it, only that he has it up the very next time your ultimate is up which gives very onesided lanes. Yes you outscale him but it's always a he can kill me but I can't kill him situation which is kinda sad.

If you rush seekers to negate his all in it's actually not a big deal for him and you sacrifice mana which also makes hexdrinker stronger in comparison since you don't have the mana to burn through. Also you lose out on lane pressure since you can't clear the waves efficient enough. You don't have damage nor mana to clear waves which opens up roams for assassins leaving you in a lose-lose situation no matter what you do in solo games.

Im fine if people have defensive options but things you can't play around do feel horrible namely hexdrinker and abyssal mask. Abyssal mask has the same problems old abyssal scepter had. If the enemy buys it you are forced to buy it too if you don't massively outrange.

I think hexdrinker also takes a lot of power budget of ad assassins since they still have enough damage with it to maintain killpressure. I only ban zed for example because I just don't want to deal with hexdrinker. I can first blood him but the moment he comes back with it it turns into a  mindless shove and stay under turret/roam lane until I have a void staff. 

Im not a game designer but from a player perspective it feels super awfull to play against.

Just had some games on the PBE as Lux. I have to say that I don't really like the new path tried.

 I tried rushing Ludens, and it was a really strong spike in damage (on loosing lanes I came back with ludens and killed the opponent or forced him back).. but once the teamfights came I had to completely forget of even trying to waveclear/poke or I would be completely oom during the teamfight. 

The spellbound orb while good on paper felt really unimpactful due to the high time required to stack. 

I never had the occasion to buy Morello. Really, once I get the 1500 gold little orb that gives me what I am looking for in the item (magic pen flat), why would I ever pay another 1500 to get 60 AP more and "not requested" GW? Why didn't you give us the opportunity to buy pen without GW (and GW alone.. I'm not eager to face a Vladimir..godbless)? Why the big flat pen item always has attached something else (yes, I DON'T WANT HP TOO)?

 the only change that really hit the mark for me at the first impression is the new Rabadon's buildpath. It finally felt not so pain to buy and I think I can finally aim to have a nice hat more or less reliably.

Next I will try AA path because really Ludens mana is not enough to sustain my high cost spells in a siege or prolonged skirmish scenario. It was supposed to be THE item for poke champions.. but you simply can't poke out of lane without ending your mana miserably

If you want to go an infinite mana build, Ludens may not be the play. You could go with a Tear -> Ludens -> Archangels build if you wanted. We can't give out too much flat pen, because it is usually the best option when you just stack them.

Penetration could however be handled with one unique-named item passive, to enable more item versatility without increasing the available magic pen. In fact, Eyes of Pain - +15 Magic Penetration already exists, so that can be an option.

The lack of mana return on Ludens/GLP is still worrisome, however. Lux, even with current {{item:3165}} still has mana issues, particularly during sieges or clearing waves without kills/assists. If a Lux were to invest into the new {{item:3285}}, I believe it solving her inherent inability to reliably clear waves is a fine trade-off, as it provides no real sustain. Her E at Max rank costs 130 mana, so the 500 mana on the item is gone within 4 uses of E, eep.  

Could the mana regeneration stat be a possible inclusion into the new AP items? If there is enough, then {{item:3174}} could once again become viable/viable rush on Lux and other mid-laners with supportive utility (she would sacrifice raw damage for more utility/sustain/defense but still scale decently with the conversion of mana regen > ap on Athene's).


EDIT:
Could Tear possibly build into these 3 items? Each receiving a different 'Quest' passive/active after completion whilst maintaining the same/similar amount of mana?
{{item:3040}} Remains the same [Best for battle/control mages]
{{item:3285}} Trades the active shield for passive poke damage (the current proc, _possibly_ with better scaling) [Best for artillery/burst mages]
{{item:3030}} Not really sure how to improve this besides giving it Health...as its new niche (besides the slow) would sit similar to {{item:3040}} [battle mages need tankiness]...maybe the slow could give a small decaying movement speed buff/spell vamp?

I really like the idea behind making tear build into other stuff: here's my thoughts

Luden's idea is good

Make GLP the 'close range battle mage' item like asol, Cass and karth where it gives tankiness and a good slow close up. Perhaps old fotm active but on self only? (Shield which slows around the player).

Change seraph's completely for control/zone mages or wombo combo mages (seraph's shield has never been a buying point at all - its main niche was being the only AP tear item. With more tear AP items the shield really doesn't shine because the other items will directly improve a mage's main capabilities, namely their damage and kiting/chasing). . I'd really really love to see an item that doesn't outright give damage but is for AP carries, so something like 'targeted area leaves a lingering field which debuffs enemies inside, if you affect someone with hard CC someone inside the field they are rooted for an additional 0.25 seconds afterwards. You slows are increased by 20% as well'.

Imo get rid of the awe mana->AP passives and put some power back into the stats and passives
Lux doesn't stack Tear anywhere near efficiently. There's a reason the champions who currently build Tear are spam-happy ones and Anivia, who can build it off her ultimate.

Only note I want to post here is regarding mana-heavy champions/skill spammers. Removing morello mana return means that you are forced to buy tear.  Luden/Morello won't be enough with just the mana they provide. I expect a shift back to RoA+Tear on a lot of champions that used to scrape by with just morello and didn't buy Roa/Tear at all. That's reducing build diversity, not increasing it. I hope you have that in mind and you'll balance accordingly instead of leaving them in a shitter for reminder of the season if they underperform.

You probably could scrape by with Luden's + Manaflow Band with smart play on all but the most mana hungry champions.  

The danger is going OOM during an extended teamfight, not so much for waveclear.  

It also puts some emphasis back towards securing blue buffs and Ocean Drakes.

Spreadsheet of Rabadon damage vs Void Staff damage: https://1drv.ms/x/s!Ah4pdH2v9szDgtBE549dmwSKFDak_w 

This Spreadsheet covers AP built before building one of them, the opponents resistance (I didn't do any scenario where Void Staff would reduce the resistance below 0%), base magic damage on ability, and the AP ratio on the ability. I did scenarios up to a 500% AP ratio so that it could be used to see impact of full combo vs single ability, as well as scenarios up to 1000 base magic damage for the same purposes. I then set up an equation to show what AP built previous to buying Rabadon's or Void Staff gave equal damage for the two items, with numbers higher than the resultant AP favoring a Void Staff build. I then filtered the 3500+ scenarios to only show positive resultant AP (where it's actually possible for the two to give equal damage outputs at some point).

This spreadsheet compares buying one over the other, and from looking at it, it's still a buy Void Staff world in almost all cases. If however Riot wants Rabadon's place to be in addition to a Void Staff, then Rabadon's may be a worthwhile item.

On specifics of equations used please see this post (helps keep this post small): https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/TaijPHAm-ap-itemization-on-pbe-84?comment=00e3

I like the changes for the most part. I think you could stand to make Morello's cheaper, 3000 gold for average stats and the 15mpen is a bit overkill. I know it has GW too but the rest of the GW items are all also very cheap, so it seems fine.
Also, I don't know how you guys could do this, but I wish you would keep GLP good for Aurelion Sol. The lost catalyst passive + health really sucks for him.

Spellbound Orb stacks a bit too slowly in my opinion, even after the buff. It doesn't seem like a great first item rush because of how long it takes to stack, and it doesn't seem especially great in teamfights either due to the active cooldown.

The only change I feel Liandry's needs is to revert back to current HP, the rest is fine as is, you can even revert it back to 2% from 1.5%.

Champions that deal max HP damage like Brand and Mordekaiser work far to well with this item as is.
Brand's passive tics for 4 seconds, standard damage has Liandry's tic 7 times, for 10.5% of a champion's max HP, 14.5% if you add in Brand's 4%.
If he buys Crystal Scepter, it jumps to 21%/25%. None of this counting damage from other sources and just 1 stack of Brand's passive.
With Mordekaiser, his rank 3 ult takes 35% (+4% per 100 AP) and tics for 10 seconds, this causes Liandry's to take 19.5% by itself and 54.5% with Morde's ult. Add in Crystal Scepter here too, it becomes 39%/74% if Morde has 0 AP (which isn't going to happen).

Just **revert to Current HP** and everything will be alright again.

Hello!

In the Mid Lane, I'm a Kennen player. I like to build Liandry's as my first item, and my only concern is that the item would become worse than how it is live, but since the PBE is off right now, I'll have to check and report later. Gonna do a buncha tests :D

**Update Two**: Well, this just feels awful...

Here's the experiment I conducted:

**Kennen**

This is a pretty big nerf to my early game and specifically my **Level 6** power spike, which is a very important point in the game for Kennen, as he can start providing help to the Jungler to control Dragon, effective ganks bot, and have an answer for ganks against him. Even the one Aery hit in PBE had less damage than the ones she didn't hit on Live :(

I know Liandry on Kennen is not the most _meta_ thing in the world, but I greatly value the Magic Penetration and the extra HP it provides. I just enjoy buying it as a first item. It's a very reliable first pick for my play style, and now I'm just concerned it's gonna be just worse on Kennen.
